benchmark_details.name: DOV4MM (Dataset Ownership Verification for Masked Modeling)
benchmark_details.overview: DOV4MM is a methodology designed to verify if a suspicious masked model has been trained on a particular unlabeled dataset, focusing on protecting dataset ownership.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Verify dataset ownership for protected datasets utilized in masked models.

data.source: ImageNet-1K, WikiText-103 subsets, Food101, COCO, Places365

methodology.calculation: Calculated through one-tailed pairwise t-test based on relative embedding reconstruction difficulty.
methodology.interpretation: A p-value less than 0.05 indicates that the suspicious model has likely been pre-trained on the dataset.
methodology.baseline_results: DOV4MM outperforms other existing methods in detecting ownership violations.
